question: You were doing a short course at another country. All of a sudden, you had to leave the course and fly back to your home country. Write a letter to your teacher, and in your letter– express your gratitude– explain why you had to leave– explain what part of the course you enjoyed the most
text: Hope this letter finds you in radiant health and the best of spirits. This letter is being written to you to express my extreme gratitude for being a part of such an amazing short course.

I am a student of your short course named Best techniques in Dental implants . I am extremely overwhelmed  with joy to learn under your guidance. All new techniques and theory concepts really going to help me in my clinical practice. It would not be wrong to say that this is one of the best decisions I made in my life.

In fact, I really do not want to leave the course in between but there was no other option for me as my grandfather got a heart attack and was admitted to  the intensive care unit of  the hospital . For taking care of him I had to leave the course and fly back to my home country .

Everything about the course was world-class but one thing which I personally enjoyed the most was putting implants in a patient's mouth . All your patients dealing techniques are outstanding and it will really help me to become a better dentist in the future.
I pen down by thanking you again for the wonderful experience I had.
